a-dreamers-universe 160762151393 "2017-05-17 08:52:32 GMT" http://a-dreamers-universe.tumblr.com/post/160762151393/parent-adam-and-belle-headcanons "tonal-gleeson: Because yes.  Belle holds off on telling Adam she’s pregnant for the longest time
column2: because she wants to be sure. Eventually
column3: she can’t decide on how to tell him
column4: so she keeps putting it off until Adam notices she’s acting strange.  Adam: “Are you okay
column5: you’ve been acting very agitated lately” Belle: “No
column6: I’m fine” Adam: “I know when you’re fine
column7: and you are not fine”  They get into an argument
column8: and Belle lets it slip that’s she’s pregnant without even meaning to. Adam goes completely silent
column9: with pure shock and joy on his face. Adam asks if she’s serious
column10: and Belle answers of course she’s serious why would she lie about this? Adam goes silent again
column11: taking it all in. He then finally rushes up to her
column13: and twirls her around in his arms.  When they announce Belle’s pregnancy to the royal court
column14: some of the nobles are all “oh have you chosen a nanny/governess?” and Adam and Belle are like “um wtf no?”  Both Adam and Belle eventually (and begrudgingly) relent when Cogsworth insists they hire a governess because they’ve become so tired they’re falling asleep at the dinner table. Still
column15: Adam and Belle take every possible opportunity to see their children. About a month before the birth
column16: Adam suddenly becomes very nervous about parenthood. The shadow of his father looms over him
column17: as well as what happened to his mother. Belle reassures him that he’s not his father
column18: and could never be.  Belle gives birth to twins: first a boy
column19: then a girl.  Adam is pacing the hell out of the floor outside the room in nervousness and anticipation. (”It’s not supposed to last this long
column20: is it?”). Cogsworth tries to calm him down
column22: the physician exits comes out to deliver the news. Adam rushes into the room
column23: overwhelmed at the sight of Belle
column24: and his new children. He starts crying
column25: and Belle starts crying at the sight.  While Adam and Belle are decisive about their son’s name
column26: they’re less so about their daughter’s. Adam wants to name her after Belle’s mother
column27: while Belle wants to name her after Adam’s. They eventually come to the consensus that the girl with have both of the mothers’ names
column29: letting Belle decide which order they will be.  Adam rivals Maurice with his overprotectiveness. Belle has to remind him not to worry constantly. Even so
column30: he’s worried that one little mistake will make him like his father.  Belle and Adam take turns readings to their children at night (and sometimes get into playful competitions over who tells the best bedtime story). They also sing to their children. All the time.  The family often go on walks in the gardens. Belle usually recites a passage from the book she’s been reading. One morning
column31: she recites from Romeo and Juliet
column32: and Adam gives her a look and says “you’re not trying to convert the children into loving that
column33: are you?” and Belle just laughs and continues to recite
column34: and Adam can’t help but love it because dammit it sounds so good when she says it.  Their children get Expensive Educations™.  " False text

a-dreamers-universe 159858643888 "2017-04-22 11:07:27 GMT" http://a-dreamers-universe.tumblr.com/post/159858643888/ssimsass-brilliancetheory "ssimsass: brilliancetheory: catsandmadteaparties: brilliancetheory:  catsandmadteaparties:  brilliancetheory:  I just think it’s funny how many Gaston fangirls I’ve seen so far pulling the “Gaston didn’t deserve to die!” card
column2: either because they’re into Luke Evans or because 2017 Gaston was in the army and therefore has PTSD and doesn’t deserve anything bad happening to him. Like… he literally refers to Belle (and women in general) as ‘prey’
column3: he attempts to murder Maurice when he tells him he can’t marry Belle
column4: he belittles Lefou and uses him as a human shield during the castle fight
column5: he shoots the Beast in the back three times
column6: but sure; he was pretty and fought in the war so poor precious baby. If that isn’t what actually makes Gaston frightening in the first place though. People (in particular women) excusing/overlooking his poor actions in favour of appearances.  Did they just entirely miss who Gaston is suppose to represent? He represents the people in society who use their privilege and influence to oppress others for their own motives.  He is a bully. He uses his privilege and influence to manipulate and ostracise people. He is a misogynistic
column7: sexist pig. He attempts to murder Belle’s father and the Beast because of his greed. He is arrogant. He ENJOYS war and violence- he is practically a sociopath. He emotionally and physically abuses Lefou.  The list could go on.  The Beast- Prince Adam- also spares Gaston when he attempted many times to murder him. it was due to his own foolishness that Gaston dies in the first place.  You can adore Luke Evans but Gaston is a piece of shit in every version of the Beauty and the Beast. He is an archetype of the bully and the oppressor.   Gaston is essentially meant to represent everything the Beast is not. The Beast seems terrifying and brutal and merciless
column8: but is in fact much softer than he appears. He learns to love and becomes selfless and caring and compassionate. But all people see is a monster. Gaston is misogynistic
column10: most likely abusive. He’s shown to be violent and cruel. He isn’t above the “if I can’t have the person I like
column12: which is an all-too real cause of violence in the real world. He’s selfish and entitled to the point of being willing to resort to murder to get what he wants. He is an actual monster
column13: but all people see is an attractive charismatic man of high social standing.  “He’s no monster
column15: you are.” Belle said it best
column17: everyone needs to take a close listen to ‘The Mob Song’ that is sung by Gaston and the villagers. That song is so close to my heart because it is so accurate in depicting how people can be manipulated into demonising
column18: scapegoating and marginalising the vulnerable because someone (like Gaston) came along and influenced the majority through fear and as well as by ‘othering’ them (in the case of BATB; Belle
column19: the Beast and Maurice)- mob mentality.  And look just how powerful these lines are: “We’re not safe until he’s dead” “Here we come
column20: We’re fifty strong And fifty Frenchmen can’t be wrong”  “We’re counting on Gaston to lead the way!” “We don’t like What we don’t understand. In fact
column21: it scares. And this monster is as mysterious at least”  “Save your children and your wives. We’ll save the village and our lives”  And the Macbeth reference: “Screw your courage to the sticking place!” sung by Gaston. Gaston- Lady Macbeth  This song actually makes me cry and emotional. Gaston is the modern day villain. Belle and the Beast are different to the majority and are people that the Villagers can’t understand. Gaston wants something from them so he uses their ‘difference’ to the majority against them in order to subdue them.  This is why I fucking LOVE this movie. It is so powerful and symbolic of society. That is what makes Gaston a fucking awesome villain because he is REAL and COMMON.   We all know many Gastons.   “There’s a beast running wild
column23: but I fear the wrong monster’s released.”I MEAN. EVEN LEFOU HAD IT FIGURED OUT. PREACH" False text

a-dreamers-universe 154507458043 "2016-12-15 14:35:28 GMT" http://a-dreamers-universe.tumblr.com/post/154507458043/ian-mckellen-beauty-and-the-beast-table-read "klstheword: Here’s a little reminder of that first day!Tuesday 14 April 2015Shepperton Studios
column2: LondonIan McKellen recalls the dayBEAUTY AND THE BEAST starts!The first read-through of a film-script gathers together the cast to meet ‘round a table and speak their words outloud for the first time: a nerve-wracking occasion as we try to impress each other and at the same time somewhat underplay
column3: lest our initial reading is not quite what the director has in mind. Today there were sly glances at our director Bill Condon
column4: who thankfully smiled benignly throughout. Behind him and ‘round us there was a further audience - Disney producers who we may not meet again until the movie’s premiere
column5: plus colleagues in charge of cameras
column9: costume and make-up who will be our constant companions throughout the shooting schedule.Today Beauty and her Beast (Emma Watson and Dan Stevens) read with their supporting cast: and a happy reunion it was for me
column10: next to Mr Holmes’ “Lady in Grey” (Hattie Morahan) along from Bard the Bowman (Luke Evans) and Kevin Kline
column11: who I haven’t seen since we received our Tony Awards together in 1981. The cast were seated 'round four long trestle tables placed in a square. In the middle on their own little stage there was a large clock and a feather duster and a candelabra
column12: who all remained static throughout the morning. Elsewhere
column13: everything and everyone was alive and even kicking
column14: high-kicking too. Bill Condon had decided to put on a show and I’ve never seen or heard anything like it.I arrived nearly late after a two-hour drive across London’s morning rush-hour: and into Shepperton Studios where films have been made since 1931. There were clusters of white roses on the tables and a mike for each actor so we could be heard above the music from the electronic keyboard and percussion and the glorious voices of a 30-strong choir. They were impressive enough
column15: until the studio lights dimmed and the chorus sprang up and danced their merry way through the classic songs by Alan Menken
column16: who was sitting next to Tim Rice who has contributed some new ones. It’s the first time that I’ve heard applause at a read-through
column17: let alone a standing ovation by the end. The legendary Audra McDonald had sung and Emma Thompson too (a cupboard and a teapot in the Beast’s bewitched household).But my favourite moment
column19: was when the Beast’s loving arm was placed tentatively on Belle’s shoulder after their pas de deux. Clearly dancing and singing rehearsals had started before today. My own are to come. I’m going to have to work hard to equal what has already been achieved. All the long way home
column21: in which I shall get to sing a line or two. Aren’t I the lucky one ….." False link

column1: a-dreamers-universe 104261155638 "2014-12-03 19:20:11 GMT" http://a-dreamers-universe.tumblr.com/post/104261155638/open-casting-call-for-disneys-moana "fuckyeahworldoftaika:   Walt Disney Animation Studios is launching a global casting call for a key role for their upcoming feature
column2: Moana
column4: 000 years ago in Oceania about a spirited teenager who learns that the future of her people is in jeopardy. Along with a lovable pot belly pig and a legendary hero
column5: Moana searches for a mythical island
column6: traversing the open ocean and encountering mystical sea creatures and underworlds on an action-packed quest to save her world and make her ancestors proud.Directed by the renowned filmmaking team of Ron Clements and John Musker (“The Little Mermaid
column10: this CG-animated adventure sets sail in late 2016. Character breakdown:MOANA – (female
column15: and confident. A teenager who yearns for something more. Strong singing voice a must.”Titiro Mai! Here is a quick guide for you:Send a video of yourself framed close up
column16: showing your head and shoulders with plenty of light on you.Introduce yourself. Practice this several times before you film.Tell us why you would make a great Moana.Then tell us your email contact and your phone contacts. Check with mum and dad if you are under the age of 18 years.Then widen the frame & film yourself in mid shot singing part of a song that you do well (no longer than one minute)Upload the video to youtube or similar sharing site (make sure to keep it private) then send us the LINK in a private message on our FB page: cnacasting or on the website cnacasting.com  " False link
